item.description:
Organizer: Michael Blair @ 978-808-1932

=====

Be sure to read the entire event description before you RSVP - then answer questions that are part of the RSVP process. While the objective is to enjoy ourselves, your safety, and the safety of the others, is the most important thing. If you underestimate the demands, overestimate your skills and abilities, or come unprepared you may put yourself and/or others at risk – consider this before you decide to participate in this event.

=====

What we're doing

While we were riding along the Minuteman Bike Path a few weeks back we got to talking about local places to get some good foo after the ride, and while we didn't go there that night the idea of getting some ribs at Redbones in Somerville, MA entered the conversation.

Not sure whose idea it was but I can say that it sounded like a great one. So a new random tradition was born that night - The Random Rib Ride.

We have picked Monday August 1 because Redbones will be having a large cookout (they will be closing down the street and will be serving under big outdoor tents) to benefit the Somerville Homeless Coalition (SHC).

The cost is $25 and all proceeds go to the SHC.  What do you get for $25?

  • Pulled Pork, Loins, Butts, and Bellies
  • Cole Slaw
  • Corn on the Cob
  • Green
  • Watermelon
  • Choice of Drinks - including Beer

But that's not all - there will also be live music by local groups.

Exercise. Food.  Friends.  Live Music.  Help those in need.  Not a bad night.

Redbones is about 1.5 miles from Alewife and while I will have a car parked at Alewife I will likely ride my bike to and from Redbones.  If you would rather walk or take the T (Redline from Alewife to Davis Square) that is up to you.

If you would like to meet us only for the ribs then just meet us there - don't even bother signing up here on the site.  Only those who are going for the ride need to RSVP.

=====

Trip Summary

The objective is to ride at about a 12 - 15 MPH pace.

We will start at Alewife Station in Cambridge and ride out towards Bedford, MA before turning around and heading back.  I would like to ride all the way to the end but  we  will turn around so that we get to Redbones at about 7 PM.

While I have been on this trail many times before I did all of my current research for this trip using the Internet. You should become familiar with this information since you are ultimately responsible for your own safety.

The Minuteman Bikeway is a former railroad right of way that travels about   11 mile  s through the historic area where the American Revolution began in April 1775 - Bedford, Lexington, Arlington, and Cambridge.   It offers a 12-foot wide paved surface for the entire length and offers several resting stops along the way.

Click here for information about the Minuteman Bikeway

=====

Weather

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants a day or two before this event.

We will assess travel and weather conditions during the ride and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

Click here for the current weather forecast for this trip

=====

Clothing and Equipment

Below is a list describing the minimum required clothing and equipment to participate in this event. DO NOT rely on others to share with you once we begin. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip.

Helmet: You must wear a properly sized and adjusted bicycle helmet that has been tested and meets the uniform safety standard issued by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC).

Food and Water: High-energy snacks and enough water to stay properly hydrated during the trip.

Other Essential Gear: White headlight and red taillight. A multi-purpose tool or small repair kit. A spare tube.

=====

Directions

We will begin by meeting at the drop off area at street level on the west side of the Alewife Parking Garage in Cambridge, MA.  According to Google Maps this meeting spot is about 7.2 miles from Boston and it should take about 20 minutes to drive there.

Click here for driving directions to the meeting spot

=====

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you and your guests acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the bicycle safety tips described at www.massbike.org; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
